Ohhh man. Now you've done it.
I'm on a 3 day trip through Michigan sampling different beers along the way. Stared in Detroit, ended in Grand Haven (wanted to check out oddside).
I've been in the service industry for a decade and know what characteristics I like in beer. I'll update you tomorrow :)

Con man: An IPL with a weird smoky, fruity taste. (Not bad, not great)
Nuketoberfest: A classic octoberfest style brewed with Bavarian yeast.
Harvest Ale: A pale ale brewed with all Michigan hops and barley. (My favorite so far)
Unfinished Business: Described as a "Japanese empowers stout." 10 different malts and Japanese rice. (Very complex and interesting)
Perrin Brewery. Comstock park, Mi.
